Wishing all those celebrating in the Virgin Islands a happy, healthy and sweet new year. 

Shanah Tovah U'metukah! https://t.co/OoLu9mxjW3

On this day in 1787, the United States Constitution was signed. 

In the face of unprecedented attacks on our rights and freedoms, I am committed to upholding our Constitution and defending American values. https://t.co/qRvaPTfRxp

Happy National Voter Registration Day! 

The right to vote is sacred and I’m committed to protecting it. 

Learn how to register to vote today at https://t.co/djdi7JT3so. https://t.co/Mnb3aowBZL

Feliz Mes Nacional de la Herencia Hispana! Estamos celebrando la cultura rica y dinámica de nuestras comunidades hispanas en las Islas Virgenes y reconociendo sus valiosas contribuciones a nuestra sociedad e historia. 

Happy Hispanic Heritage Month! We are celebrating the rich and vibrant culture of our Hispanic/Latino communities across the Virgin Islands and recognizing their invaluable contributions to our history and society.

Each year on September 11th, grieving families and loved ones come together on the sacred grounds of the 9/11 Memorial plaza for a deeply moving ceremony. 

With profound love and remembrance, they honor each precious life lost by speaking aloud the names of the 2,983 beloved souls—fathers, mothers, children, brothers, sisters, friends, and colleagues—whose lives were tragically cut short on that devastating day in 2001. 

Today, we continue to stand in solemn remembrance of the thousands of innocent lives lost and honor the heroism of the first responders who answered the call to danger.

Suicide prevention isn’t just about helping in moments of crisis — it’s about recognizing warning signs, promoting treatment and recovery, and building robust support networks. 

Together, we can save lives. If you or a loved one need help, call or text 988. https://t.co/4upokUrTQj

Hope is possible through recovery from addiction. 

This National Recovery Month, I’m fighting to restore health care funding that ensures Americans can recover and live happy, healthy lives. https://t.co/yBqjszyQlN

Today, on National Grandparents Day, we honor the wisdom, love, and strength of our grandparents who have laid the foundation for our families and our communities. 

Their sacrifices, guidance, and stories remind us of where we come from and inspire us to keep moving forward. 

To all the grandparents in the Virgin Islands and across our nation—thank you for the unconditional love you give and the legacy you continue to build.

On Labor Day, we honor the achievements of American workers. 

I am proud to stand with working men and women to celebrate the progress that organized labor has made in strengthening America’s middle class and helping our nation become stronger, fairer, and more prosperous. https://t.co/dt3uEZLaen

The 1963 March on Washington saw hundreds of thousands of people gather in our nation’s capital, demanding an end to segregation and discrimination. 

Today, we honor their legacy and demand a more just and equal future. https://t.co/tTsMOQBzHx

105 years ago, the 19th Amendment became part of the Constitution and American women could finally vote across the country. 

On Women’s Equality Day, we continue the fight for equality for women in every area of life. https://t.co/Ig6ca8YfDY

On National Purple Heart Day, we honor the extraordinary valor and selfless service of America's Purple Heart recipients. 

This includes the brave veterans from the Virgin Islands who have sacrificed for our nation alongside their fellow service members from every state and territory.

Medicare and Medicaid help secure a brighter, healthier future for millions of American families. 

Today, as they turn 60, we are fighting to protect and strengthen these vital lifelines. https://t.co/RwPdSU3i4I

On July 26, 1990, the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) was signed into law. 

Disability Pride Month commemorates this legislation and reaffirms the rights of people with disabilities to inclusion and respect. https://t.co/FwQhw7PWKM

Nelson Mandela was a visionary — a leader who dared to dream of a more just and inclusive world. 

On Mandela Day, we honor his contributions and legacy and look to him as an example as we continue the fight for equality. https://t.co/HCZ4HgIEry
Incredibly honored to host my Sorors from the VI for a special reception in honor of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority’s 57th National Convention in Washington, D.C.! https://t.co/Jw1glqfFZd

Nearly two and a half centuries ago, our nation was born with a promise of liberty and justice for all. 

This Independence Day, we remember the sacrifices of those who fought for our freedoms as we seek to make that promise come true for all Americans, even while we continue to fight for equitable and equal representation as Virgin Islanders.
Take your time and let the American people know what Trumps GOP has planned for them

Parks and recreational spaces are essential to healthy and sustainable communities in the Virgin Islands and across the country. 

This National Park and Recreation Month, we’ll keep working so our parks are accessible and enjoyable for all. https://t.co/nwrCRJe2qt

Follow the money.

Republicans' "One Big Beautiful Bill" isn't about efficiency—it's a $43 BILLION handout to private contractors over 10 years.

Just ONE example: Forcing states to pay Equifax $20 per person to verify employment data for 18 MILLION people EVERY MONTH.

That's $360 million monthly and $4.32 billion yearly.

Experts are calling it what it is: "Welfare for Deloitte."

This isn't government efficiency. This is organized graft—creating red tape just to line the pockets of powerful contractors.

We must expose this scheme for what it really is: robbing taxpayers to enrich the well-connected.
#GovernmentAccountability #StopTheGrift

House Republicans’ Big Beautiful Bill is only beautiful to the wealthy individuals who stand to gain—not to the 16 million Americans who would lose access to healthcare and the 4.5 million people who would lose food assistance—not to the third of the population in my home of the Virgin Islands, that lives beneath the poverty line. 

The Congressional Budget Office confirms that this plan would be one of the largest wealth transfers to the rich in U.S. history. 

We cannot allow this to happen.

As we close out Caribbean American Heritage Month, I'm reminded of the countless ways Caribbean Americans have enriched our nation 🇺🇸🌴

From the flavors in our kitchens to the rhythms at our festivals, from classrooms to courtrooms, Caribbean Americans continue to strengthen America's tapestry. We are entrepreneurs, educators, artists, and leaders who embody the values of hard work, family, and community.

Our story is one of transforming challenges into opportunities while preserving our vibrant culture. We've colored the American landscape with Caribbean vibrancy and continue to advance our nation's promise of diversity and inclusion.

To all my fellow Caribbean Americans: your contributions matter, your heritage is celebrated, and your impact on America is profound.
Happy Caribbean American Heritage Month! 🎉
#CaribbeanAmericanHeritageMonth #ProudlyCaribbean #USVI

On June 19, 1865, news of the Emancipation Proclamation reached the last enslaved people in Galveston, Texas. 
Today, we celebrate the progress our nation has made and acknowledge that the fight for equality is far from over. https://t.co/kGayMxj4DU

The Virgin Islands' remote geography makes our rural hospitals literal lifelines. 

When someone suffers a heart attack on St. John or faces a medical emergency on St. Croix, these facilities aren't just convenient options—they're the difference between life and death. 

I continue to urge my colleagues to remember that healthcare equity means ensuring that zip code—or in the Virgin Islands’ case, which island you call home—doesn't determine whether you live or die.

#HandsoffMedicaid

Last week, I met with the Delegation of Cameroon to discuss critical electoral support and humanitarian concerns, including protecting women voters and conflict resolution. 

With growing global competition for influence in Africa, US leadership on election monitoring and humanitarian support is more crucial than ever. #DemocracyMatters
Today we honor and celebrate all the fathers, grandfathers, and father figures both here with us and those who have passed on. Happy Father’s Day! https://t.co/MPfGTRHqbu
Wherever it flies, the American flag stands as a beacon of liberty, progress, and hope. On Flag Day, we’re proud to honor this time-honored symbol of our nation. https://t.co/U4c4H4cdGR

- on the front lines

Today, my colleagues and I wear orange in honor of #GunViolenceAwarenessMonth.
 
Every day, gun violence impacts families and communities across our nation—just yesterday we lost another life in my home. Behind every statistic is a person with dreams, loved ones, and a future that was cut short.
 
Let's honor those we've lost by working toward a future where everyone feels safe in their community. 🧡
 
#CommunityStrong #ViolencePrevention
Eid Mubarak! Wishing you and your families an Eid of reflection, togetherness, peace, and joy. https://t.co/OnpQLQijq4

Today, on World Environment Day, we are reminded of our responsibilities as good stewards of our planet and beautiful places like my home, the Virgin Islands. 
Every sustainable action that we take today ensures that our natural wonders will be available for future generations to enjoy.
June is Men’s Health Month! From education to early detection to support, we can all play a role in making our country a healthier place for everyone, including men and boys. https://t.co/bRz1eJirpK
Happy Pride Month! Pride is a time to celebrate the contributions of the LGBTQ+ community to our society and to continue the ongoing struggle for equality and justice. https://t.co/WiKlUaxHtL

Gun Violence Awareness Month is a solemn remembrance of those who’ve lost their lives to gun violence. In their honor, we will continue to work to end gun violence once and for all. https://t.co/1qJymJOOAj
Chag Sameach! Wishing you and your families a day of celebration, learning, reflection, and togetherness. https://t.co/ArG8i9R7BS

June 1st officially marks the beginning of the 2025 Atlantic hurricane season which continues until November 30th. This year, the National Oceanic Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) predicts a 60% chance of an above-normal season, with a range of 13 to 19 total named storms, including 3 to 5 major hurricanes.

During this very critical time, I urge each of you to make sure you prepare your homes, your businesses and your families if you haven’t already.

You can save/print our Hurricane Preparedness Checklist below to help you prepare. Also, please utilize the resources provided by the VI Territorial Emergency Management Administration or VITEMA. You can visit their website at https://t.co/Wj3k0af7o0 or call their office at 340-774-2244.

Each June, we celebrate Caribbean American Heritage Month. I am incredibly proud of my Caribbean heritage and often say we are far more than beautiful beaches and Carnival celebrations. 

We are a fiercely resilient people, shaped by a history written in the blood of our ancestors and marked by their courage and triumph over great injustices.
 
It is more important than ever that we remember and tap into the strength of who we are as individuals of Caribbean heritage.
 
Happy Caribbean American Heritage Month to all who celebrate!
We thank them for the allyship during that Great War. Praying rest for all those that gave the ultimate sacrifice

Freedom isn’t free. 
Today, we remember and honor the brave men and women who gave their lives for our country. https://t.co/d8xODHEnEd

This week, I met with the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Region 2 leadership including Regional Administrator Martucci, Deputy Regional Administrator Arcaya, Caribbean Environmental Protection Director Guerrero, and Caribbean Environmental Protection Deputy Director Velez. 

We discussed the current status of funding made available to the Virgin Islands by EPA, which plays an instrumental role in supporting the resilience of our community. We also discussed environmental initiatives in the cruise line sector, including carbon credits, and how this can support the Virgin Islands economy.

I remain committed to ensuring federal resources reach our islands to protect our drinking water, manage wastewater effectively, and create sustainable infrastructure that serves all Virgin Islanders.

#WorkingForUSVI #CleanWaterForAll #EnvironmentalJustice

My deepest condolences to the families of Yaron and Sarah – to Israeli embassy staffers, committed to Israeli/Palestine dialogue—who were killed tragically here in Washington, D.C. 

Violence has no place. Praying for our communities. We must all live in safety and without fear.
SMDH.

Since the Big Mess of a Budget Bill did not pass on Friday, we members of the Budget committee were called into a meeting to vote at 10p this evening.

Republicans literally rushed to jam through a bill that makes the largest cuts to Medicaid and food assistance in American history—ripping away lifelines that tens of millions of Americans rely on.

And, do not be fooled—the “no” votes from certain Republicans on Friday were because the cuts were not fast or deep enough. In the back room, Republicans agreed to deeper and especially faster cuts to programs. 

My Democratic colleagues and I are still here, though. And, we will still fight to protect care, lower costs, and invest in working families. 
💯💪🏽🙏🏽

At 3:15am, @WaysMeansCmte  colleagues like @RepJimmyGomez and I were doing our best stay awake to fight for the American people. Hard to do? Nah. 

Particularly because of the ABSURDITY of Republicans' unwillingness to vote to protect the access of basic necessities like food and healthcare for millions of Americans.

We're the side chick to the one person the Trump administration has married--the donor class--and they are giving them the real money while we're just getting a little piece on the side. But, we👏🏽will👏🏽FIGHT👏🏽for what should belong to hard-working Americans and our neediest.

Men lie. Women lie. Numbers don't.

Giving money to the rich does not raise wages or grow new jobs. And how do we know? Because the 2017 tax bill did not grow the economy, did not spur manufacturing, did not bring new jobs. We know this because the numbers tell us that. @WaysMeansCmte

Some of the cuts to critical programs include--cuts to food assistance (SNAP) to the tune of $300 BILLION, which are about equal to cost of EXPANDING the estate tax deduction [$250 billion]. 

The nonpartisan CBO confirmed that this bill WILL STRIP 13.7 MILLION PEOPLE of their healthcare coverage by gutting ACA and Medicaid. Big Beautiful Bill my A$$.

Our seniors are the foundation of our families and the bedrock of our communities.

This Older Americans Month, we share our appreciation for America’s seniors and reaffirm our promise to protecting Social Security and Medicaid – the hard-earned benefits that they worked their entire lives for.

During National Nurses Week, we recognize the hardworking and caring nurses of the Virgin Islands and across the country. 
Thank you for your dedication to your patients and commitment to providing lifesaving care at every stage of life. https://t.co/SABEaDfzgS

Happy Teacher Appreciation Week to every educator in the Virgin Islands and across our country. Our territory and our nation are better because of the work that you do every day to teach the next generation and equip them with the skills they need to succeed. https://t.co/igRJNHUHpY

Earlier this week, I had the opportunity to speak with a group of students in the Georgetown Caribbean Culture Center about my experiences as a student at Georgetown, the current Administration’s policies and the current political climate, as well as the importance of civic engagement.

I love spending time with young people. They remind me of the promise and potential of youth. 
We must do right by them. #HoyaSaxa

Senators claim they’re afraid. I’m not afraid. Are you? Appears that some love their position more than the country.  Our job is to speak for our people. Tell at least four senators: DO YOUR JOB. Stand up for the people who have no voice. https://t.co/XLh4JRO7WA

They send us to fight — but deny us the right to vote. In the Virgin Islands, we bleed for this country. But we have no vote for president. No full representation in Congress. No senator to defend us. And now they want to do the same to the rest of you — to eat you alive to feed their own greed. We must stand firm and strong against the destructive agenda that the Trump administration has for the most vulnerable of us.

Virgin Islanders live what they threaten you with. Budget cuts are not a theory to me — they are my community’s reality. Every. Single. Day. A third of the children in the Virgin Islands go without health care because of caps like the ones Congress now wants for the whole country. Wake up. They’re coming for you next.

As I begin negotiations on the Reconciliation—tax and budget bill in Ways and Means and Budget having sufficient information on needs is very important. 

Appreciative of our continued collaboration with our Puerto Rico partners. Meeting with the Secretary of the Treasury of Puerto Rico Angel Pantoja and representatives from the office of Governor Jenniffer González-Colón.

In his first 100 days, Trump has failed to uphold his promises to improve the lives of working people, including the number one demand of the American people – to lower prices – and instead is crashing the economy, dismantling essential federal programs for working people, ignoring the rule of law, and jeopardizing our national security. 

@NewDemCoalition

Today I met with the American Bus Association Foundation’s Board of Governors to discuss the importance of group travel on economic growth, the need for tariff relief and a regulatory environment that promotes travel & tourism. https://t.co/3kVXgH6PNK

Today on the House floor, I proudly recognized the fierce brilliance of the U.S. Virgin Islands Science Bowl champions—students from the St. Croix Educational Complex High School and the Church of God Holiness Academy. 

These exceptional students are not just national competitors—they are shining examples of Caribbean intellect, Virgin Islands pride, and the limitless potential of our youth. I know they will represent us well! 

#VIStrong

No more school lunches. No more Meals on Wheels. That’s what Republicans are pushing with their $2 TRILLION in budget cuts. Over 11,000 Virgin Islands students rely on school meals. Our farmers, our children—all under attack. We’re not isolated. We’re impacted. And I’m fighting back.

Tax cuts for billionaires. Budget cuts for students. The University of the Virgin Islands just lost millions in federal support—including funding for climate research and biomedical PhD programs. Republicans are gutting DEI and stripping opportunity from our young people. I won’t stand by and let this happen.

May their memories be for a blessing and may #NeverAgain be a lasting reality. https://t.co/63d3F7j9rI

Republicans want to ZERO OUT Head Start funding. That’s thousands of kids, dozens of schools, and hundreds of teachers in the Virgin Islands left with nothing. No early education. No child care. No support. This is an attack on our future—and we won’t let it slide. Speak out. Stand up.

22 million Americans. 20,000 Virgin Islanders. That’s how many rely on Medicaid. Republicans want to slash over $880 BILLION in healthcare funding—devastating our most vulnerable: children, seniors, veterans. HHS is already shutting down. Washington’s actions are hurting the Virgin Islands. We will not stay silent.

70 MILLION Americans depend on Social Security and one in three households include a Social Security beneficiary, yet the Trump Administration has classified it as a “Ponzi scheme,” with plans to dismantle this critical program that supports the most vulnerable among us. In my district of the Virgin Islands, there are over 20 thousand Social Security recipients, including our elders and children.

Social Security is a sacred trust that represents a return on the contributions that hard-working Americans have made into the system for decades. It is the responsibility of the Congress to continue to safeguard Social Security for all Americans.

#PROTECTSocialSecurity
#SocialSecurityDayofAction

In honor of Virgin Islands History Month and Women's History Month, today we present Dr. Marcella Nuñez-Smith, who served as Senior Advisor to the White House COVID-19 Response and Chair of the Presidential COVID-19 Health Equity Task Force at the Department of Health and Human Services.

Dr. Nuñez works to address disparities, particularly among marginalized communities and is a strong advocate for improving medical access in the Caribbean. 

Photo Credit: New York Times

In honor of Virgin Islands History Month and Women's History Month, today we present Edith L. Williams, an excellent educator and suffragist in the U.S. Virgin Islands.

Ms. Williams was the founder of the Suffragist League on St. Thomas in the 1930's and was a trailblazer in the pursuit of women's voting rights in the territory. In December 1935, she became the first woman to apply for voter registration in the Virgin Islands. 

Photo Credit: Wikipedia

In honor of Virgin Islands History Month and Women's History Month, today we present Brigadier General Deborah Howell, the first female Adjutant General of the Virgin Islands National Guard.

A trailblazer in military leadership, Brigadier General Howell dedicated her career to service, breaking barriers for women in the armed forces and making significant contributions to the security and resilience of the U.S. Virgin Islands.

Photo Credit: The Virgin Islands Consortium

We know Medicaid saves lives. Approximately 21,000 Virgin Islanders rely on this critical program for their healthcare needs. Republicans are pushing a nearly $1 trillion Medicaid cut that will force Virgin Islanders and millions of Americans into a place of no access to health care. I am fighting back to save Medicaid and protect the most vulnerable among us.

In honor of Virgin Islands History Month and Women's History Month, today we present Janelle James, a talented comedian, writer, and actress.

Her success serves as an inspiration, highlighting the contributions of Caribbean women in the arts.

Photo Credit: Paramount Theatre https://t.co/axyXmSipOT

In honor of Virgin Islands History Month and Women's History Month, today we present Tiphanie Yanique, an acclaimed writer whose work explores themes of Caribbean identity, history, and womanhood.

Her storytelling blends lyrical prose with deep historical and cultural narratives, making her a significant voice in both Caribbean and women's literature.

Photo credit: Restless Books

In honor of Virgin Islands History Month and Women's History Month, today we present Eileen R. Petersen, a trailblazing judge and the first woman to serve on the Virgin Islands Territorial Court.

Mrs. Petersen was a dedicated advocate for justice and gender equality, paving the way for future generations of women in law and public service.

Photo Credit: The St. Thomas Source

In honor of Virgin Islands History Month and Women's History Month, today we present Myrah Keating Smith, a healthcare pioneer in the U.S. Virgin Islands.

Her legacy lives on through her contributions to public health and her efforts to ensure accessible healthcare for the people of the Virgin Islands.
